steps.title: Enter *86 (*VM) at the dialer screen on your Verizon mobile device, then press “Call.
steps.content: Enter *86 (*VM) at the dialer screen on your Verizon mobile device, then press “Call. ” This command dials directly into Verizon’s voicemail system.

steps.title: Enter your voicemail passcode at the prompt, then press the “#” key.
steps.content: Enter your voicemail passcode at the prompt, then press the “#” key. You will now hear the voicemail main menu options.

steps.title: Press “4” to access Personal Options, then press “3” to access Greetings.
steps.content: Press “4” to access Personal Options, then press “3” to access Greetings.

steps.title: Press “1” to change your personal greeting.
steps.content: Press “1” to change your personal greeting.

steps.title: Follow the telephone prompts to select, record, and save your new voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Follow the telephone prompts to select, record, and save your new voicemail greeting. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the “1” button on the dialer screen of your AT&T wireless device.
steps.content: Press and hold the “1” button on the dialer screen of your AT&T wireless device. This command dials you into the AT&T voicemail system.

steps.title: Press “3” to access the Greetings menu.
steps.content: Press “3” to access the Greetings menu. You will hear a variety of voicemail greeting options.

steps.title: Press 1” to change your personal voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Press 1” to change your personal voicemail greeting.

steps.title: Record your greeting at the prompt, then press “#” when you’ve finished recording your greeting.
steps.content: Record your greeting at the prompt, then press “#” when you’ve finished recording your greeting.

steps.title: Follow the telephone prompts to save your new voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Follow the telephone prompts to save your new voicemail greeting.

steps.title: Press and hold the “1” button on the dialer screen of your T-Mobile device.
steps.content: Press and hold the “1” button on the dialer screen of your T-Mobile device. This command automatically dials into the T-Mobile voicemail system.

steps.title: Press the * key to access the main menu of the voicemail system.
steps.content: Press the * key to access the main menu of the voicemail system.

steps.title: Press “3” to access the voicemail greeting menu.
steps.content: Press “3” to access the voicemail greeting menu.

steps.title: Press “2” to record a new personal greeting.
steps.content: Press “2” to record a new personal greeting. The existing greeting will play first, and the system will confirm that you want to replace your current greeting.

steps.title: Record your greeting at the prompt, then press “#” when you finish your new greeting.
steps.content: Record your greeting at the prompt, then press “#” when you finish your new greeting.

steps.title: Press “1” to confirm that you want to use the new recording as your new voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Press “1” to confirm that you want to use the new recording as your new voicemail greeting. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the “1” button on the dialer screen of your Sprint phone.
steps.content: Press and hold the “1” button on the dialer screen of your Sprint phone. This command automatically dials into Sprint’s voicemail system.

steps.title: Press “3” to access Personal Options, then press “2” to access Greetings.
steps.content: Press “3” to access Personal Options, then press “2” to access Greetings.

steps.title: Press “1” to change your voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Press “1” to change your voicemail greeting. You can either record a personal greeting, or select the standard, automatic greeting.

steps.title: Press “1” to record a personal greeting, or press “2” to select the standard greeting.
steps.content: Press “1” to record a personal greeting, or press “2” to select the standard greeting. If you choose to record a personal greeting, the voicemail system will walk you through recording your greeting.

steps.title: Press the “#” key to end your recording.
steps.content: Press the “#” key to end your recording.

steps.title: Press “1” to confirm and save your new voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Press “1” to confirm and save your new voicemail greeting.

steps.title: Dial *86 (*VM) from your US Cellular device, then press “Call.
steps.content: Dial *86 (*VM) from your US Cellular device, then press “Call. ” This command will dial you into the voicemail system’s main menu.

steps.title: Press “3” to access the Greetings menu.
steps.content: Press “3” to access the Greetings menu. You will hear options to set or record a new voicemail greeting.

steps.title: Press “1” to set a new personal voicemail greeting, then follow the telephone prompts to record and save your greeting.
steps.content: Press “1” to set a new personal voicemail greeting, then follow the telephone prompts to record and save your greeting. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Dial *298 from your Cox home telephone to access the voicemail system.
steps.content: Dial *298 from your Cox home telephone to access the voicemail system.

steps.title: Enter your voicemail PIN at the prompt, followed by the “#” key.
steps.content: Enter your voicemail PIN at the prompt, followed by the “#” key.

steps.title: Press “3” to access the Greetings menu.
steps.content: Press “3” to access the Greetings menu. You will hear options to record, enable, or disable a variety of voicemail greetings, such as an “All Calls” greeting, the “No Answer” greeting, an “Out of the Office” greeting, and more.

steps.title: Press the appropriate number at the prompt to change your voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Press the appropriate number at the prompt to change your voicemail greeting. For example, if you want to change the voicemail greeting that all callers hear, press “1” to record an “All Calls” greeting.

steps.title: Follow the telephone prompts to record and save your new voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Follow the telephone prompts to record and save your new voicemail greeting. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Dial *99 on your Comcast or Xfinity home telephone.
steps.content: Dial *99 on your Comcast or Xfinity home telephone.

steps.title: Press “#” at the greeting, then enter your voicemail passcode.
steps.content: Press “#” at the greeting, then enter your voicemail passcode. You will now hear the main menu options for the voicemail system.

steps.title: Press “4” to access Personal Options, then press “3” to access the Greetings menu.
steps.content: Press “4” to access Personal Options, then press “3” to access the Greetings menu.

steps.title: Press “1” to access Personal Greetings.
steps.content: Press “1” to access Personal Greetings. You will now hear options to set up either a standard greeting or personal greeting.

steps.title: Press “1” to use a standard greeting with your phone number, press “2” to use a standard greeting with your name, or press “3” to record a new personal greeting.
steps.content: Press “1” to use a standard greeting with your phone number, press “2” to use a standard greeting with your name, or press “3” to record a new personal greeting.

steps.title: Follow the telephone prompts to record and save your new voicemail greeting.
steps.content: Follow the telephone prompts to record and save your new voicemail greeting. [5] X Research source
